synimu Vignettes

Source: vignettes/vignettes.Rmd
vignettes.Rmd

In Zhang et al. (2021), we introduce a method allowing to compute synthetic (or average) signals issued from multiple correlated and/or even non-stationary signals. In a nutshell, this method minimizes a weighted average of the wavelet variance of the synthetic signal whose weights can be chosen depending on the application at hand. This method is illustrated with gyroscopes which often contain non-stationary processes such as random walks. This package implements the method of Zhang et al. (2021), called Scale-wise Variance Optimization or SVO, as well as the approach of Vaccaro and Zaki (2017), which is used as a comparison.

  • real example (case study in the paper, don’t talk about vaccaro)
  • how to generate data (corresponds to 2 simulations in the paper)
  • how to do the simulations, compare with vaccaro (first one work well, second one no)
  • how to produce the graphs in the paper, can be as functions or simply code
  • keep: Figures 2, 4, 7, 8, 9
  • For Figures 3, 10 we simply discuss it, no need to produce the graph
  • fix seed, can use cache=TRUE

Data generation

The package synimu allows to simulate data from various multivariate composite (or latent) time series models. For example, consider the model “white noise + random walk,” which in a multivariate setting can be expressed as follows. Let \(W_t \sim \mathcal{N}(\mathbf{0}, \mathbf{R})\), \(Y_t \sim \mathcal{N}(\mathbf{0}, \mathbf{Q})\) and

\[X_t = X_{t-1} + Y_t,\] where \(\mathbf{R}\) and \(\mathbf{Q}\) are covariance matrices. Then, we assume that \(X_t\), \(W_t\) and \(Y_t\) are latent but we observe \(Z_t\) which is defined as

\[Z_t = X_t + W_t.\]

state-space models

Generate sample data from a gyroscope array following a white noise plus random walk error model

library(synimu)

kjg

(cobb1978problem?)

ref

Vaccaro, Richard J., and Ahmed S. Zaki. 2017. “Reduced-Drift Virtual Gyro from an Array of Low-Cost Gyros.” Sensors 17 (2). https://doi.org/10.3390/s17020352.
Zhang, Yuming, Davide A. Cucci, Roberto Molinari, and Stéphane Guerrier. 2021. “Scale-Wise Variance Minimization for Optimal Virtual Signals: An Approach for Redundant Gyroscopes.” http://arxiv.org/abs/2106.15997.
